snippet: Iranian officials pointed to a ruling against the Danish shipping giant over 10 containers that were sent to the United Arab Emirates in 2005.
abstract: Navy is deploying warships to protect American commercial vessels passing through Strait of Hormuz after Iran seizes Maersk Tigris container ship.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and DANNY HAKIM
byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg reported from Washington, and Danny Hakim from London. Eric Schmitt and Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Iranian officials pointed to a ruling against the Danish shipping giant over 10 containers that were sent to the United Arab Emirates in 2005.

headline.main: U.S. Sends Ships to Strait of Hormuz to Shield Vessels After Iran Seizure
headline.print_headline: U.S. Raises Profile in Strait of Hormuz After Iranians Seize a Cargo Vessel
